intro: Hieracium lenifoliatum, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium lenifoliatum is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
